articles.title: About Me
articles.description: Lizzie is a senior studying journalism at The George Washington University’s School of Media and Public Affairs in Washington, DC. At SMPA, Lizzie has developed her skills in newswriting, video production, and reporting. She is passionate about the environment, the arts, and social justice and is currently seeking full-time opportunities in the environmental media field. Lizzie contributes written and video content for Planet Forward and is currently interning with the Mother Earth Podcast. When she isn’t writing, Lizzie enjoys fencing and rollerblading.

articles.title: Experience
articles.contents:
Work Experience


Planet Forward - Correspondent

Mar. 2019 – Present
Washington, DC
• Published online articles and videos covering sustainability stories, including food waste and water pollution.
• Finalist in 2020 Storyfest competition for Best Multimedia Story.

Mother Earth Podcast – Production Intern

Jan. 2021 – Present
Remote
• Assisted with entire production process, including researching guests, editing interview transcripts, and writing episode scripts.

The YEARS Project – Enviro. Research & Journalism Intern

Sept. 2020 – Dec. 2020
Remote
• Wrote blog posts highlighting local climate issues, synthesized political and climate news and research, moderated social media channels, assisted with video production.

American News Women’s Club – Club Admin. Coordinator

May 2020 – Aug. 2020
Washington, DC
• Crafted Club newsletter and facilitated communications and renewals among 130+ members.
• Hosted Club events, maintained external media channels, and managed operations of historic Clubhouse.

Potomac Conservancy – Communications Intern

Sep. 2019 – Dec. 2019
Silver Spring, MD
• Assisted with running social media accounts, including Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, and wrote blog posts.
• Maintained event calendar and analyzed volunteer demographic data.

SMPA Media and Peacebuilding Project – Research Assistant

Feb. 2019 – Aug. 2019
Washington, DC
• Led team of three research assistants in coding computer-generated data based on a Hate Speech Intensity Scale.
• Created code book and used content analysis and data visualization to develop report on hate speech in the media.
• Assisted with multiple projects, including organizing a conference and researching global hate speech.

The GW Hatchet – Staff Writer

Sept. 2017 – Dec. 2018
Washington, DC
• Published weekly articles for the Metro beat covering local government, transportation, and the GW Hospital.
• Interviewed and built relationships with beat sources including ANC commissioners and District agencies.
• Worked with other reporters to cover live events and pitch and produce professional articles using AP style.

Lavner Camps and Programs – Technology Instructor

June 2017 – Aug. 2018
Fort Washington, PA
• Instructed camps in Programming with Java and Python, LEGO EV3 Robotics, and Filmmaking with iMovie.
• Instructed and supervised children aged 5-14 and developed interpersonal skills by working with other instructors.

Chestnut Hill Local – Intern

June 2016 – Aug. 2016
Philadelphia, PA
• Wrote, pitched, and published weekly articles, working closely with the editor-in-chief.
• Researched, conducted interviews, and took photographs to add detail to the articles.

Volunteer Experience


GWU Alternative Breaks – Participant

Jan. 2019 – Jan. 2020
Various
• Participated on two alternative breaks service-learning trips to learn about sustainable agriculture in Puerto Rico and migrant workers’ rights in Immokalee, FL.

Extracurricular Activities


GWU Club Fencing – President

Sept. 2017 – Present
Washington, DC
• Trained new fencers and led the team in practice and tournaments.

GWU Wind Ensemble & Symphonic Band – Oboist

Sept. 2017 – Present
Washington, DC

PWHS Town Crier School Newspaper – Editor-in-Chief

Sept. 2014 – June 2017
Plymouth Meeting, PA
• Developed the newspaper’s first website, greatly increased membership and visibility.
• Published articles in every issue during high school career.
